awd_abstract_narration: Winthrop College requests support from NSF for connection of its                campus network to SURAnet.  SURAnet is the midlevel network                     located in the southeastern area of the country and comprises 13                states.  It will provide operations management and information                  services and it will give Winthrop College a 56 thousand bits per               second connection to the NSFNET, a high speed (1.5 - 45 million                 bits per second) National Backbone network.                                                                                                                     The College needs greater functionality and network speed to be                 able to access supercomputers, libraries, and make file transfers               along with being able to implement a more reliable mail system.                 Students and faculty research will benefit from the link.  This                 is also a unique opportunity for the school to explore innovative               educational resources.***//
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems
